contentrichtext.text: {{otherships|USS Moccasin}} {|{{Infobox Ship Begin}} {{Infobox Ship Image |Ship image=[[Image:USS Moccasin (SS-5).jpg|300px|USS Moccasin in Manila Bay, 1912]] |Ship caption=USS ''A-4'' (ex-''Moccasin'') in Manila Bay, 1912 }} {{Infobox Ship Career |Hide header= |Ship country= |Ship flag={{USN flag|1922}} |Ship name=USS ''Moccasin'' |Ship namesake= |Ship ordered= |Ship builder=[[Crescent Shipyard]], [[Elizabeth, New Jersey]] |Ship laid down=8 November 1900 |Ship launched=20 August 1901 |Ship acquired= |Ship commissioned=17 January 1903 |Ship decommissioned=12 December 1919 |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship struck= |Ship homeport= |Ship motto= |Ship nickname= |Ship honors= |Ship fate=Sunk as target |Ship status= |Ship notes= }} {{Infobox Ship Characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship class={{sclass|Plunger|submarine}} |Ship displacement={{convert|107|LT|t|abbr=on}} |Ship length={{convert|64|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship beam={{convert|12|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship draft={{convert|11|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship propulsion= |Ship speed={{convert|8|kn|mph km/h|lk=in|abbr=on}} surfaced <br /> {{convert|7|kn|mph km/h|abbr=on}} submerged |Ship range= |Ship test depth= |Ship complement=7 officers and men |Ship armament=1 Ã— {{convert|18|in|mm|abbr=on}} [[torpedo tube]] |Ship notes= }} |} [[Image:USS A-4 torpedo tube.jpg|300px|thumb|A 1912 view of the breech of the sole [[torpedo tube]] of USS ''A-4''. Two [[torpedo]]es are on wooden skids in the foreground. The skids slid across the deck for loading.]] The second '''USS ''Moccasin'' (SS-5)''' was a {{sclass|Plunger|submarine}} that was later renamed ''A-4''. She was laid down under the direction of [[Arthur Leopold Busch]] on 8 November 1900 in [[Elizabeth, New Jersey]] at the [[Crescent Shipyard]], launched on 20 August 1901, and commissioned on 17 January 1903 at the Holland yard at New Suffolk, N.Y. with [[Ensign (rank)|Ensign]] Frank L. Pinney in command. Assigned to duty at the [[Naval Torpedo Station]] at Newport, ''Moccasin'' operated locally on principally training and experimental activities until assigned to the [[Reserve Torpedo Flotilla]] at Norfolk on 15 June 1904, in which unit she remained inactive for the next half decade. On 20 July 1909, the submarine torpedo boat was loaded onto the [[Collier (ship type)|collier]] {{USS|Caesar|AC-16|2}}, which sailed soon thereafter for the [[Philippines]]. ''Moccasin''{{'}}s sister-ship, {{USS|Adder|SS-3|2}}, was on board as deck cargo as well, lashed to the auxiliary's forward well deck. Arriving at [[Olongapo]] on 1 October, ''Moccasin'' was launched on 7 October. Recommissioned on 10 February 1910, she was assigned to the [[First Submarine Division]], [[United States Asiatic Fleet|Asiatic Torpedo Fleet]], based in the [[Manila]] area. ==A new name== ''Moccasin'' was renamed ''A-4'' on 17 November 1911. During [[World War I]], like her sister-ships, she patrolled the entrance to [[Manila Bay]] and convoyed ships moving out of local waters. Later placed in reserve, ''A-4'' was decommissioned at [[Cavite]] on 12 December 1919. ==References== *{{DANFS|http://www.history.navy.mil/danfs/m13/moccasin-ii.htm}} ==External links== *[http://www.history.navy.mil/photos/sh-usn/usnsh-m/ss5.htm Photo gallery] at Naval Historical Center *[http://www.navsource.org/archives/08/08005.htm Photo gallery] at Navsource.org {{Plunger class submarine}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Moccasin (Ss-5)}} [[Category:Ships built in New Jersey]] [[Category:Plunger-class submarines|Moccasin 005]] [[Category:World War I submarines of the United States]] [[Category:1901 ships]] [[Category:Ships sunk as targets]]
